member.name: T:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.ContentInfo
member.summary: The class represents the CMS/PKCS #7 ContentInfo data structure as defined in the CMS/PKCS #7 standards document. This data structure is the basis for all CMS/PKCS #7 messages.

member.name: M:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.ContentInfo.#ctor(System.Byte[])
member.summary: The constructor creates an instance of the class by using an array of byte values as the data and a default object identifier (OID) that represents the content type.
member.param: An array of byte values that represents the data from which to create the object.
member.exception: A null reference was passed to a method that does not accept it as a valid argument.

member.name: M:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.ContentInfo.#ctor(System.Security.Cryptography.Oid,System.Byte[])
member.summary: The constructor creates an instance of the class by using the specified content type and an array of byte values as the data.
member.param: An object that contains an object identifier (OID) that specifies the content type of the content. This can be data, digestedData, encryptedData, envelopedData, hashedData, signedAndEnvelopedData, or signedData. For more information, see Remarks.
An array of byte values that represents the data from which to create the object.
member.exception: A null reference was passed to a method that does not accept it as a valid argument.

member.name: P:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.ContentInfo.Content
member.summary: The property retrieves the content of the CMS/PKCS #7 message.
member.returns: An array of byte values that represents the content data.

member.name: P:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.ContentInfo.ContentType
member.summary: The property retrieves the object that contains the object identifier (OID) of the content type of the inner content of the CMS/PKCS #7 message.
member.returns: An object that contains the OID value that represents the content type.

member.name: M:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.ContentInfo.GetContentType(System.Byte[])
member.summary: The static method retrieves the outer content type of the encoded message represented by an array of byte values.
member.param: An array of byte values that represents the encoded message from which to retrieve the outer content type.
member.returns: If the method succeeds, the method returns an object that contains the outer content type of the specified encoded message. If the method fails, it throws an exception.
member.exception: A null reference was passed to a method that does not accept it as a valid argument.
An error occurred during a cryptographic operation.

member.summary: The property retrieves the set of certificates associated with the enveloped CMS/PKCS #7 message.

member.returns: An object that represents the algorithm identifier.

member.summary: The property retrieves the inner content information for the enveloped CMS/PKCS #7 message.
member.returns: A object that represents the inner content information from the enveloped CMS/PKCS #7 message.

member.name: M:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.EnvelopedCms.Decode(System.Byte[])
member.summary: The method decodes the specified enveloped CMS/PKCS #7 message and resets all member variables in the object.
member.param: An array of byte values that represent the information to be decoded.
member.exception: A null reference was passed to a method that does not accept it as a valid argument.

member.name: M:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.EnvelopedCms.Decrypt(System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.RecipientInfo,System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Collection)
member.summary: The method decrypts the contents of the decoded enveloped CMS/PKCS #7 message by using the private key associated with the certificate identified by the specified recipient information and by using the specified certificate collection. The method searches the specified certificate collection and the My certificate store for the proper certificate to use for the decryption.
member.param: A object that represents the recipient information to use for the decryption.

An collection that represents additional certificates to use for the decryption. The method searches this certificate collection and the My certificate store for the proper certificate to use for the decryption.
member.exception: A null reference was passed to a method that does not accept it as a valid argument.
A cryptographic operation could not be completed.
A method call was invalid for the object's current state.

member.name: M:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.EnvelopedCms.Decrypt(System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Collection)
member.summary: The method decrypts the contents of the decoded enveloped CMS/PKCS #7 message by using the specified certificate collection. The method searches the specified certificate collection and the My certificate store for the proper certificate to use for the decryption.
member.param: An collection that represents additional certificates to use for the decryption. The method searches this certificate collection and the My certificate store for the proper certificate to use for the decryption.
member.exception: A null reference was passed to a method that does not accept it as a valid argument.
A cryptographic operation could not be completed.
A method call was invalid for the object's current state.

member.name: M:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.EnvelopedCms.Decrypt
member.summary: The method decrypts the contents of the decoded enveloped CMS/PKCS #7 message. The method searches the current user and computer My stores for the appropriate certificate and private key.
member.exception: A cryptographic operation could not be completed.
A method call was invalid for the object's current state.

member.name: M:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.EnvelopedCms.Decrypt(System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.RecipientInfo)
member.summary: The method decrypts the contents of the decoded enveloped CMS/PKCS #7 message by using the private key associated with the certificate identified by the specified recipient information.
member.param: A object that represents the recipient information that identifies the certificate associated with the private key to use for the decryption.
member.exception: A null reference was passed to a method that does not accept it as a valid argument.
A cryptographic operation could not be completed.
A method call was invalid for the object's current state.

member.name: M:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.EnvelopedCms.Encode
member.summary: The method encodes the contents of the enveloped CMS/PKCS #7 message and returns it as an array of byte values. Encryption must be done before encoding.
member.returns: If the method succeeds, the method returns an array of byte values that represent the encoded information. If the method fails, it throws an exception.
member.exception: A method call was invalid for the object's current state.

member.name: M:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.EnvelopedCms.Encrypt(System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.CmsRecipient)
member.summary: The method encrypts the contents of the CMS/PKCS #7 message by using the specified recipient information.
member.param: A object that represents the recipient information.
member.exception: A null reference was passed to a method that does not accept it as a valid argument.
A cryptographic operation could not be completed.

member.name: M:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.EnvelopedCms.Encrypt(System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.CmsRecipientCollection)
member.summary: The method encrypts the contents of the CMS/PKCS #7 message by using the information for the specified list of recipients. The message is encrypted by using a message encryption key with a symmetric encryption algorithm such as triple DES. The message encryption key is then encrypted with the public key of each recipient.
member.param: A collection that represents the information for the list of recipients.
member.exception: A null reference was passed to a method that does not accept it as a valid argument.
A cryptographic operation could not be completed.

member.name: P:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.EnvelopedCms.RecipientInfos
member.summary: The property retrieves the recipient information associated with the enveloped CMS/PKCS #7 message.
member.returns: A collection that represents the recipient information. If no recipients exist, the property value is an empty collection.

member.name: P:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.EnvelopedCms.UnprotectedAttributes
member.summary: The property retrieves the unprotected (unencrypted) attributes associated with the enveloped CMS/PKCS #7 message. Unprotected attributes are not encrypted, and so do not have data confidentiality within an object.
member.returns: A collection that represents the unprotected attributes. If no unprotected attributes exist, the property value is an empty collection.

member.name: P:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.EnvelopedCms.Version
member.summary: The property retrieves the version of the enveloped CMS/PKCS #7 message.
member.returns: An int value that represents the version of the enveloped CMS/PKCS #7 message.

member.name: T:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.KeyAgreeRecipientInfo
member.summary: The class defines key agreement recipient information. Key agreement algorithms typically use the Diffie-Hellman key agreement algorithm, in which the two parties that establish a shared cryptographic key both take part in its generation and, by definition, agree on that key. This is in contrast to key transport algorithms, in which one party generates the key unilaterally and sends, or transports it, to the other party.

member.name: P:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.KeyAgreeRecipientInfo.Date
member.summary: The property retrieves the date and time of the start of the key agreement protocol by the originator.
member.returns: The date and time of the start of the key agreement protocol by the originator.
member.exception: The recipient identifier type is not a subject key identifier.

member.name: P:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.KeyAgreeRecipientInfo.EncryptedKey
member.summary: The property retrieves the encrypted recipient keying material.
member.returns: An array of byte values that contain the encrypted recipient keying material.

member.name: P:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.KeyAgreeRecipientInfo.KeyEncryptionAlgorithm
member.summary: The property retrieves the algorithm used to perform the key agreement.
member.returns: The value of the algorithm used to perform the key agreement.

member.name: P:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.KeyAgreeRecipientInfo.OriginatorIdentifierOrKey
member.summary: The property retrieves information about the originator of the key agreement for key agreement algorithms that warrant it.
member.returns: An object that contains information about the originator of the key agreement.

member.name: P:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.KeyAgreeRecipientInfo.OtherKeyAttribute
member.summary: The property retrieves attributes of the keying material.
member.returns: The attributes of the keying material.
member.exception: The recipient identifier type is not a subject key identifier.

member.name: P:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.KeyAgreeRecipientInfo.RecipientIdentifier
member.summary: The property retrieves the identifier of the recipient.
member.returns: The identifier of the recipient.

member.name: P:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.KeyAgreeRecipientInfo.Version
member.summary: The property retrieves the version of the key agreement recipient. This is automatically set for objects in this class, and the value implies that the recipient is taking part in a key agreement algorithm.
member.returns: The version of the object.

member.name: T:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.KeyTransRecipientInfo
member.summary: The class defines key transport recipient information. Key transport algorithms typically use the RSA algorithm, in which an originator establishes a shared cryptographic key with a recipient by generating that key and then transporting it to the recipient. This is in contrast to key agreement algorithms, in which the two parties that will be using a cryptographic key both take part in its generation, thereby mutually agreeing to that key.

member.name: P:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.KeyTransRecipientInfo.EncryptedKey
member.summary: The property retrieves the encrypted key for this key transport recipient.
member.returns: An array of byte values that represents the encrypted key.

member.name: P:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.KeyTransRecipientInfo.KeyEncryptionAlgorithm
member.summary: The property retrieves the key encryption algorithm used to encrypt the content encryption key.
member.returns: An object that stores the key encryption algorithm identifier.

member.name: P:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.KeyTransRecipientInfo.RecipientIdentifier
member.summary: The property retrieves the subject identifier associated with the encrypted content.
member.returns: A object that stores the identifier of the recipient taking part in the key transport.

member.name: P:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.KeyTransRecipientInfo.Version
member.summary: The property retrieves the version of the key transport recipient. The version of the key transport recipient is automatically set for objects in this class, and the value implies that the recipient is taking part in a key transport algorithm.
member.returns: An int value that represents the version of the key transport object.

member.summary: Represents an attribute used for CMS/PKCS #7 and PKCS #9 operations.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using a specified string representation of an object identifier (OID) as the attribute type and a specified ASN.1 encoded data as the attribute value.
member.param: The string representation of an OID that represents the PKCS #9 attribute type.

member.returns: An object that represents the algorithm.

member.returns: An array of byte values that represents the encoded public component of the public key pair.

member.name: T:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.RecipientInfo
member.summary: The class represents information about a CMS/PKCS #7 message recipient. The class is an abstract class inherited by the and classes.

member.name: P:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.RecipientInfo.EncryptedKey
member.summary: The abstract property retrieves the encrypted recipient keying material.
member.returns: An array of byte values that contain the encrypted recipient keying material.

member.name: P:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.RecipientInfo.KeyEncryptionAlgorithm
member.summary: The abstract property retrieves the algorithm used to perform the key establishment.
member.returns: An object that contains the value of the algorithm used to establish the key between the originator and recipient of the CMS/PKCS #7 message.

member.name: P:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.RecipientInfo.RecipientIdentifier
member.summary: The abstract property retrieves the identifier of the recipient.
member.returns: A object that contains the identifier of the recipient.

member.name: P:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.RecipientInfo.Type
member.summary: The property retrieves the type of the recipient. The type of the recipient determines which of two major protocols is used to establish a key between the originator and the recipient of a CMS/PKCS #7 message.
member.returns: A value of the enumeration that defines the type of the recipient.

member.name: P:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.RecipientInfo.Version
member.summary: The abstract property retrieves the version of the recipient information. Derived classes automatically set this property for their objects, and the value indicates whether it is using PKCS #7 or Cryptographic Message Syntax (CMS) to protect messages. The version also implies whether the object establishes a cryptographic key by a key agreement algorithm or a key transport algorithm.
member.returns: An value that represents the version of the object.

member.name: M:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.RecipientInfoEnumerator.MoveNext
member.summary: The method advances the enumeration to the next object in the collection.
member.returns: This method returns a bool that specifies whether the enumeration successfully advanced. If the enumeration successfully moved to the next object, the method returns true. If the enumeration moved past the last item in the enumeration, it returns false.

member.name: T:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.SubjectIdentifier
member.summary: The class defines the type of the identifier of a subject, such as a or a . The subject can be identified by the certificate issuer and serial number or the subject key.

member.name: P:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.SubjectIdentifier.Type
member.summary: The property retrieves the type of subject identifier. The subject can be identified by the certificate issuer and serial number or the subject key.
member.returns: A member of the enumeration that identifies the type of subject.

member.name: P:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.SubjectIdentifier.Value
member.summary: The property retrieves the value of the subject identifier. Use the property to determine the type of subject identifier, and use the property to retrieve the corresponding value.
member.returns:
An object that represents the value of the subject identifier. This can be one of the following objects as determined by the property. property
Object
IssuerAndSerialNumber
SubjectKeyIdentifier

member.name: T:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.SubjectIdentifierOrKey
member.summary: The class defines the type of the identifier of a subject, such as a or a . The subject can be identified by the certificate issuer and serial number, the hash of the subject key, or the subject key.

member.name: P:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.SubjectIdentifierOrKey.Type
member.summary: The property retrieves the type of subject identifier or key. The subject can be identified by the certificate issuer and serial number, the hash of the subject key, or the subject key.
member.returns: A member of the enumeration that specifies the type of subject identifier.

member.name: P:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.SubjectIdentifierOrKey.Value
member.summary: The property retrieves the value of the subject identifier or key. Use the property to determine the type of subject identifier or key, and use the property to retrieve the corresponding value.
member.returns:
An object that represents the value of the subject identifier or key. This can be one of the following objects as determined by the property. property
Object
IssuerAndSerialNumber
SubjectKeyIdentifier
PublicKeyInfo

member.name: T:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.SubjectIdentifierOrKeyType
member.summary: The enumeration defines how a subject is identified.

member.name: F:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.SubjectIdentifierOrKeyType.IssuerAndSerialNumber
member.summary: The subject is identified by the certificate issuer and serial number.

member.name: F:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.SubjectIdentifierOrKeyType.PublicKeyInfo
member.summary: The subject is identified by the public key.

member.name: F:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.SubjectIdentifierOrKeyType.SubjectKeyIdentifier
member.summary: The subject is identified by the hash of the subject key.

member.name: F:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.SubjectIdentifierOrKeyType.Unknown
member.summary: The type is unknown.

member.name: T:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.SubjectIdentifierType
member.summary: The enumeration defines the type of subject identifier.

member.name: F:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.SubjectIdentifierType.IssuerAndSerialNumber
member.summary: The subject is identified by the certificate issuer and serial number.

member.name: F:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.SubjectIdentifierType.NoSignature
member.summary: The subject is identified as taking part in an integrity check operation that uses only a hashing algorithm.

member.name: F:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.SubjectIdentifierType.SubjectKeyIdentifier
member.summary: The subject is identified by the hash of the subject's public key. The hash algorithm used is determined by the signature algorithm suite in the subject's certificate.

member.name: F:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.SubjectIdentifierType.Unknown
member.summary: The type of subject identifier is unknown.
